_header: The world so wide the air so remevable
Note:
It is the first stanza of 5533; and is often followed by 5411. Halsham’s authorship [South] is disputed by Bühler (1940)
XBühler, Kurt. “Lydgate’s Horse, Sheep and Goose and Huntington MS HM 144.” Modern Language Notes 55 (1940): 563-69.
_description: A single stanza rhyme royal, occurring separately and in combinations

The worlde so wide thaire so remuableThe sely man so litel of
                    stature…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…That made is of these foure thus flyttyngMay stedfast be as
                    here in his lyving
